Generation IV.Diamond: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
Generation IV.Pearl: It sends signals to others by carving odd patterns in frost-covered trees and ice.
Generation IV.Platinum: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.

Generation V.Black: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.
Generation V.White: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.
Generation V.Black 2: They communicate by clawing signs in boulders and work together to surround enemies.
Generation V.White 2: They communicate by clawing signs in boulders and work together to surround enemies.

Generation VI.X: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.
Generation VI.Y: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.

Generation VII.Sun: They travel in groups of four or five, leaving signs for one another on trees and rocks. They bring down their prey with coordinated attacks.
Generation VII.Moon: They dwell in cold places. This Pokémon's main food source in Alola is Vulpix and Sandshrew , which they carefully divide among their group.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: One Weavile will trip a Sandshrew and flip it over, and then another Weavile will deal the finishing blow with its sharp claws.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Thanks to its increased intelligence, scrapping over food is a thing of the past. A scratch from its claws will give you a case of frostbite!

Generation VIII.Sword: They attack their quarry in packs. Prey as large as Mamoswine easily fall to the teamwork of a group of Weavile.
Generation VIII.Shield: With its claws, it leaves behind signs for its friends to find. The number of distinct signs is said to be over 500.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It sends signals to others of its kind by carving odd patterns on trees and ice.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: This species corners prey as a pack, under the guidance of a leader. Weavile displays increased cunning, leading me to speculate that its evolution caused further brain development.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.
Generation IX.Violet: They travel in groups of four or five, leaving signs for one another on trees and rocks. They bring down their prey with coordinated attacks.

Generation VIII.Sword: Bridge Field ( Wanderer ) Bridge Field , Stony Wilderness , West Lake Axewell ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield: Bridge Field ( Wanderer ) Bridge Field , Stony Wilderness , West Lake Axewell ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Expansion Pass: Slippery Slope , Frostpoint Field , Snowslide Slope ( Wanderer ) Frostpoint Field , Giant's Bed , Snowslide Slope , Giant's Foot , Frigid Sea ( Max Raid Battle )

Generation IX.Scarlet: North Province: Glaseado Mountain Tera Raid Battles ( 5★ )
Generation IX.Violet: North Province: Glaseado Mountain Tera Raid Battles ( 5★ )

method: Level up (holding Razor Claw, during the night)
